title.rendered: “I’m going to work hard to earn every person’s vote”: Stacey Abrams’ Statement as Democratic Nominee for Governor of Georgia

content.rendered:
ATLANTA – Today, Stacey Abrams released a statement after being named the Democratic nominee for governor of Georgia:

“I’m proud to be the Democratic nominee for governor of Georgia. Whether you voted for me or not, I’m proud that so many people turned out and tuned in to this election. I’m going to work hard to earn every person’s vote because this election is not about me. It is about the single parent in Commerce. It is about the teacher in Albany. It is about the dock worker in Savannah and the hardworking nurse in Macon. It is about making sure that together we are creating a state where everyone can thrive. 

From now until November there are going to be so many twists and turns. I’m going to work hard, but I’m going to make mistakes. But what I want you to know is what will remain constant — my commitment to you. My commitment remains to One Georgia. A Georgia where we rise together, where we thrive together, where everyone is guaranteed access and where everyone has a chance at success.

But we can’t get there alone. We can open the gates of Georgia wide for everyone, if we do it together. And that is why I’m inviting you to go to my website at staceyabrams.com to learn more about my plans for Georgia and our plans for moving forward. 

We’re going to fight hard and we’re going to fight for each other. And I know we can win. So let’s get it done.”

The video to Stacey’s statement can be found here.

###
